intro: Lapathum rubellum, commonly known as red sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive reddish-purple stems and leaves, which are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
